Uses of Class
pieces.Position

  • Packages that use Position 
    Package Description
    board  
    pieces  

    • Uses of Position in board

      Methods in board that return Position 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Position Board.getBoardPosition(int file, int rank)
      Returns position corresponding to file and rank parameters.
      Position Board.getPositionKing(java.lang.String color, Board board)
      Gets position of king of same color as piece calling this methodical method.
      Methods in board with parameters of type Position 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Pieces Board.atPosition(Position p)
      Method to get the piece that is at the position on the board specified.
      static boolean Board.isUnderAttack(Pieces piece, Position p, Board board)
      Checks if position is under attack by opponent of the player calling this method.

    • Uses of Position in pieces

      Methods in pieces that return Position 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Position Pieces.getPosition()
      Method to get piece's current position.
      Methods in pieces with parameters of type Position 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Pawn.canAttack(Position np, Board board)
      Tests if pawn can attack the position desired or if the new position results in an en passant.
      boolean Pieces.canMoveThrough(Position np, Board board)
      Method that returns true if positions between the current piece's position and its desired position are empty, false otherwise.
      boolean Pieces.isOutOfBounds(Position np, Board board)
      Checks if piece is leaving confines of the board.
      boolean Pieces.isTeammate(Position np, Board board)
      Method that returns false if the destination spot has a teammate, as a piece may not take a teammate.
      boolean Rook.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Tests if Rook can hypothetically move to the new position.
      boolean Queen.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Test if Queen can hypothetically move to the given position.
      abstract boolean Pieces.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Abstract method that depends on the piece.
      boolean Pawn.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Method to check if piece can hypothetically move to given position.
      boolean Knight.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Test if Knight can hypothetically move to the given position.
      boolean King.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Takes in a position and tests if the piece can hypothetically move there.
      boolean Bishop.isValid(Position np, Board board)
      Method to check if Bishop can hypothetically move to new position.
      boolean Rook.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves the Rook to the new position specified.
      boolean Queen.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves queen to specified space.
      abstract boolean Pieces.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves piece from current position to new position.
      boolean Pawn.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves the pawn piece to new space.
      boolean Knight.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves Knight to specified space.
      boolean King.move(Position np, Board board)
      Moves the King to the position if the resulting spot is a valid move.
      boolean Bishop.move(Position np, Board board)
      Method to move Bishop to new position.
      boolean Pawn.promotionMove(java.lang.String promotion, Position np, Board board)
      If the player specified a piece to promote to, this method will replace current pawn with the piece that they specified.
      boolean King.testKing(Position np, Board board)
      Method to test if the king may move to the desired position without putting itself in check.
      boolean Pieces.testPosition(Pieces piece, Position np, Board board)
      Method that tests if a move puts king into check with a dummy board.
      Constructors in pieces with parameters of type Position 
      Constructor and Description
      Bishop(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position position)
      Constructor to create instance of the Bishop Chess piece.
      King(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position currentPosition)
      Constructor to create a King instance.
      Knight(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position currentPosition)
      Constructor to create an instance of the Knight Chess piece.
      Pawn(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position currentPosition)
      Constructor for creating a pawn instance.
      Pieces(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position currentPosition)
      Constructor to be used by Pieces subclasses to initialize common fields.
      Queen(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position currentPosition)
      Construct to create instance of Queen piece.
      Rook(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String color, Position position)
      Constructor to create instance of Rook.
